title: Torque and work - kinetic energy of pulley

content.question: A string is wrapped around a pulley of radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>, as shown. Each end of the string is attached to a block, which are initially held at rest, and the blocks are released simultaneously. Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, of mass <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, begins accelerating downward while Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> accelerates upward. The string does not slip on the pulley, and the pulley rotates with negligible friction about an axis at the center of the pulley. The string exerts tension forces with magnitudes <math alttext="uppercase T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="uppercase T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> on Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, respectively. After a time interval <math alttext="delta lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>, the pulley has angular speed <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math>. Which of the following expressions is equal to the pulley’s rotational kinetic energy after a time <math alttext="delta lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math> ?

<math alttext="one half, open parenthesis, m sub 2 plus m sub 1, close parenthesis, r squared omega squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="one half, open parenthesis, uppercase T sub 2 minus uppercase T sub 1, close parenthesis, r omega delta lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>ω</mi><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>
